author: CTV Vancouver
title: Home invader who killed Surrey dad sentenced to life in prison
text:
The man convicted of killing Surrey realtor Colin Hill during a home invasion has been sentenced to life in prison with no parole eligibility for 17 years.
The 42-year-old victim was gunned down while fighting to give his wife and children more time to hide after Khouri Lamar Green forced his way into their house in July 2015.
Green pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in the shocking slaying in November, and was handed his sentence Monday in B.C. Supreme Court.
Prior to his latest conviction, court records show the 22-year-old had a history of breaking into homes and of violating probation orders.
He was on probation when he murdered Hill as well.
The victim, a hard worker and dedicated family man, was hailed as a hero for his attempt to protect his loved ones during the terrifying attack, which happened just before midnight on a Sunday.
Hill noticed someone trying to break into their home near 64th Avenue and 166th Street, and immediately tried to block to the door to keep the intruder outside.
He lost the struggle, but called out to his family that an armed robber was inside, giving them a chance to find a safe space to hide.
Hill was shot and died at the scene. None of his family members were harmed.
Police said the home invasion was committed at random, and that there was no connection between Green and the property.
